title: bbglab/deepUMIcaller pipeline parameters
description: FASTQ to VCFs with Duplex-seq data

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/fastquorum/usage#samplesheet-input).

ref_fasta.description: The path to the prepared reference FASTA. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

targetsfile.description: BED file with the targeted regions.
targetsfile.help_text: BED file that contains the regions to be included in the analysis.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

projectname.description: Project name to use for the SigProfiler outputs.
projectname.help_text: Project name to use for the SigProfiler outputs. Do NOT use spaces in the name.

main_options.title: Main options
main_options.description: Most common options used for the pipeline

remove_offtargets.help_text: This will slightly speed up the analysis by focusing on the regions of interest according to the provided BED file

step.description: Choose from which process start. Options: 'mapping' (default), 'filterconsensus', 'groupreadsbyumi', 'unmapped_consensus', 'allmoleculesfile', 'calling'.
step.help_text: With this parameter, you can execute only the calling, for example. You would include bam files in your input csv.

perform_qcs.description: Perform additional QCs that are useful for posterior analysis.

splitted_original_sample.description: Input CSV contains several FASTQs from the same original library (sample).
splitted_original_sample.help_text: Merges multiple sequencing lanes/files from the same biological sample. Only applicable when --step is 'mapping'. Ignored for other entry points.

splitfastq_parts.description: Number of parts to split FASTQ files into.

split_by_chrom.description: Enable splitting of BAM files by chromosome.
split_by_chrom.help_text: Enables chromosome-based parallelization for improved performance. Only applicable when --step is 'mapping'. Ignored for other entry points.

filter_regions.description: Enable for filtering low_mappability and low_complex regions from the analysis.
filter_regions.help_text: With this parameter, you can flag variants present in the defined regions.

low_mappability_file.description: BED file with the low mappability regions.
low_mappability_file.help_text: BED file that contains the regions to be discarded in the analysis.

low_complex_file.description: BED file with the low complex regions.
low_complex_file.help_text: BED file that contains the regions to be discarded in the analysis.

nanoseq_snp_file.help_text: BED file that contains the regions to be discarded in the analysis.

nanoseq_noise_file.description: BED file with noisy/variable genomic sites.
nanoseq_noise_file.help_text: BED file that contains the regions to be discarded in the analysis.

global_exons_file.description: BED file with global regions to annotate coverage of AS-XS discarded reads.
global_exons_file.help_text: BED file with global regions to annotate coverage of AS-XS discarded reads.

grouping.title: Read grouping options
grouping.description: Options for when grouping reads by UMI

groupreadsbyumi_edits.help_text: Maximum number of allowable edits for fgbio's GroupReadsByUmi.

groupreadsbyumi_min_map_q.description: Minimum mapping quality of reads to be grouped.
groupreadsbyumi_min_map_q.help_text: Minimum mapping quality of reads to be grouped.

consensus_calling.title: Consensus reads options
consensus_calling.description: Options for when creating consensus reads

call_min_baseq.help_text: The minimum input base quality to use when calling a consensus for fgbio's CallMolecularConsensusReads/CallDuplexConsensusReads.

call_min_reads_duplex.description: Minimum reads to call a consensus when using duplex reads
call_min_reads_duplex.help_text: The minimum reads to call a consensus for fgbio's CallDuplexConsensusReads.

consensus_filtering_general.title: Consensus filtering options for all the confidence levels
consensus_filtering_general.description: Options for when filtering consensus reads

maxN_prop_per_read.description: The maximum proportion of Ns in a consensus read
maxN_prop_per_read.help_text: The maximum proportion of Ns in a consensus read for it to be kept when filtering using fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

filter_strand_agreement.description: Require agreement of both strands in duplex consensus
filter_strand_agreement.help_text: Require agreement of both strands to define each base of the duplex consensus.

all_molecules_filtering.title: Consensus filtering options for the all molecules used for recounting the mutations.
all_molecules_filtering.description: Options for when filtering all molecules reads

filter_min_reads_am.description: Minimum reads to keep a consensus
filter_min_reads_am.help_text: The minimum reads to keep a consensus for fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

filter_min_baseq_am.help_text: The minimum consensus base quality to keep when calling a consensus for fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

filter_max_base_error_rate_am.description: The maximum error rate for a single consensus base
filter_max_base_error_rate_am.help_text: The maximum error rate for a single consensus base when filtering a consensus for fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

calling_parameters.title: Variant calling options
calling_parameters.description: Options for variant calling and variant filtering.

vardict_filter_params.description: Parameters for the filtering step in VarDict
vardict_filter_params.help_text: Parameters for the filtering step in VarDict

vardict_chunks.description: Number of parallel VarDict chunk jobs to create (controls parallelization level).
vardict_chunks.help_text: Set to 1 to run VarDict on a single node; higher values create more parallel chunk jobs.

use_teststrandbias.description: Whether to use teststrandbias.R script in VarDict calling

consensus_filtering.title: Consensus filtering options for the duplex reads
consensus_filtering.description: Options for when filtering consensus reads for the duplex reads.

filter_min_reads_duplex.description: Minimum reads to keep a consensus
filter_min_reads_duplex.help_text: The minimum reads to keep a consensus for fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

filter_min_baseq_duplex.help_text: The minimum consensus base quality to keep when calling a consensus for fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

filter_max_base_error_rate_duplex.description: The maximum error rate for a single consensus base
filter_max_base_error_rate_duplex.help_text: The maximum error rate for a single consensus base when filtering a consensus for fgbio's FilterConsensusReads.

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

genome.help_text:
If using a reference genome configured in the pipeline using iGenomes, use this parameter to give the ID for the reference. This is then used to build the full paths for all required reference genome files e.g. `--genome GRCh38`. 

See the [nf-core website docs](https://nf-co.re/usage/reference_genomes) for more details.

igenomes_base.description: Directory / URL base for iGenomes references.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

ensembl_vep_options.title: Ensembl VEP options
ensembl_vep_options.description: VEP related files required for the annotation.

vep_genome.help_text: For the latest human genome assembly this should be: GRCh38.

vep_species.description: Species to use for Ensembl VEP.
vep_species.help_text: Use `homo_sapiens` when working with human data.

vep_cache_version.help_text: Make sure to also update the container to use. Otherwise leave 108.

vep_params.description: Additional parameters for running Ensembl VEP.

vep_cache.help_text: Define a place to store the Ensembl VEP cache.

read_processing_options.title: FASTP options
read_processing_options.description: Define parameters for the processing of the reads.

final_read_size.description: Parameter to define the maximum read size.
final_read_size.help_text: Parameter to define the maximum read size.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.
